current-chamber.#text:
IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED
		  STATES

official-title.#text:
To require the Federal Government to
		  expedite the sale of underutilized Federal real property.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Environment and Public
			 Works

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following bill; which
			 was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Federal Real Property Asset Management
			 Reform Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

The purpose of this Act is to increase the
			 efficiency and effectiveness of the Federal Government in managing real
			 property by—

requiring agencies to maintain an
			 up-to-date inventory of real property;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to develop guidance on and ensure the implementation of strategies for
			 better managing Federal real property; and

text.#text: establishing a

authorizing a pilot program to expedite the
			 disposal of surplus real property.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, is amended by adding at the end the
			 following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Chapter 5 of
			 subtitle I of title 40, United States Code

Each Federal agency shall—

continuously survey real property under the
				control of the Federal agency to identify excess property, underutilized
				property, and other real property suitable to be used for—

colocation with other Federal agencies;
				or
consolidation with other facilities;

promptly report excess property and
				underutilized property to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report on all
				excess property and underutilized property in the inventory of the Federal
				agency, including—

text.#text: submit to the

whether underutilized property can be
				better utilized; and

assess leased space to identify space that
				is not fully used or occupied;

on an annual basis and subject to the
				guidance of the

conduct an inventory of real property under
				control of the Federal agency; and

make an assessment of each real property,
				which shall include—

the age and condition of the
				property;

the size of the property in square footage
				and acreage;

the geographical location of the property,
				including an address and description;

the extent to which the property is being
				utilized;

the actual annual operating costs
				associated with the property;

the total cost of capital expenditures
				associated with the property;

sustainability metrics associated with the
				property;

the number of Federal employees and
				functions housed at the property;

the extent to which the mission of the
				Federal agency is dependent on the property;

the estimated amount of capital
				expenditures projected to maintain and operate the property over each of the
				next 5 years after the date of enactment of this subchapter; and

any additional information required by the

shall establish and maintain a

				custody and control of all Federal agencies.

text.#text:

the proceeds obtained from the disposal of

all costs associated with the
				disposal.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may
				authorize the expedited disposal of not more than 200 surplus
				properties.

text.#text: On an annual basis, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall give priority to surplus properties that have the
				highest fair market value and the greatest potential for disposal.

in consultation with the head of the applicable

text.#text:
Any real property authorized to be disposed
				of by sale of under

Surplus property may be disposed of under
				this section only if disposal of the property will generate monetary proceeds
				to the Federal Government that—

exceed the costs of disposal of the
				property; and

are not less than 90 percent of fair market
				value.

Any expedited disposal of real property
				conducted under this section shall not be subject to—
any section of

,
				nothing in this subchapter terminates or in any way limits the authority of any
				Federal agency under any other provision of law to dispose of real

text.#text: Except as provided in

Of the proceeds received from the disposal
				of any real property under this subchapter—

not less than 80 percent shall be returned
				to the general fund of the Treasury for debt reduction;

the lesser of 18 percent or the share of
				proceeds otherwise authorized to be retained under law shall be retained by the
				Federal agency that has custody and is accountable for the real property,
				subject to

not greater than 2 percent shall be made
				available to carry out

any remaining share of the proceeds shall
				be returned to the general fund of the Treasury for Federal budget deficit
				reduction.

Any proceeds retained by Federal agencies
				under this section shall be—

deposited into the appropriate real
				property account of the Federal agency that had custody and accountability for
				the real property, with the funds expended only as authorized in annual
				appropriations Acts;
used—

by not later than 2 years after the date of
				disposal of the real property; and

only for activities relating to Federal
				real property asset management and disposal; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall be deposited in the Treasury and used for Federal
				budget deficit reduction.
